author: Jeronimo Backes
title: DaPassword - a password manager
description: Your credentials stored securely on the cardano blockchain forever. No recurring fees. No central server controlling your data.

assessments.note: Web-based, centralized password managers are horrendous. People are looking for a secure and reusable solution and this will be it. This proposal has the potential of bringing in an enormous group of new users to Cardano.

The proposal does not in itself solve a general problem but what it presents is another utility for the Cardano blockchain & the security it offers. In the absence of any blockchain-based password system (that I know of), this solution leverages the functionalities of Cardano in a novel way. There are numerous password applications currently on the market, all providing sustainable business models. This proposal does that with the added benefit of no 3rd party servers being involved (except for the authenticator) and more importantly provides an education pathway for users unaware of Cardano.
The idea of password manager in the blockchain will assist in users being able to manage their accounts and in the same light control their data.

The principle of having people use the blockchain without even being aware of it is key to driving adoption of Cardano to an ever increasing percentage of the general population. Password managers are certainly an application that more and more of us use on a daily basis, taking advantage of blockchain infrastructure to improve the technology and potentially expose the strengths of decentralisation and Cardano in the process is bound to have a large impact.
Based on the addressed comments, self-identifying credentials, and GitHub profile, the proposer is very capable in implementing the proposal successfully.

Given the proposers background and the GitHub information provided, there's a high likelihood the solution can be implemented. The proposal lists the dev plans required to produce the product including breakdowns in costing. It does not however present the number of resources required for the project (solo vs team effort) and it would benefit greatly if this info is provided for better clarity. Also for better clarity, entering 'time it will take' to complete each of the activities will provide transparency to voters on how the product can be completed in the 6 month time-frame presented.

Biggest issue, which is mentioned, is how to mange costs when saving new passwords. This can happen very regularly. If not backup then user may loose local copy. If backed up everytime a password is updated this could very quickly become more expensive. Is there an ability to batch users updates offchain?
Security very important here. This will become a target. Please provide evidence of security programming exereince.
assessments.reply: Some of the questions raised here have been addressed in the comments of the proposal (couldn't edit the proposal when such questions were raised)

assessments.note: I was monitoring this proposal in the last round of funding and can say for certain that details that were missing last time are here now on how this will work and be accomplished. Great job!

The project seems very thought through, all elements and metrics are considered, sustainability has been taken into account, the budget requested seems appropriate. The only thing I'm concerned about with this project is, something mentioned in one of the comments, the fact that you have to pay a fee each time the data is stored on the blockchain. Even at current rates of transaction fees, if someone has a really large number of logins that are constantly updated or if someone is constantly creating new ones, it could end up being prohibitively expensive. This issue could escalate if the price of ADA increases.
Sufficient information is provided in the proposal. Thoughtful responses in the comment section further warrant the highest score.

The proposal lists the functionalities of the solution and at the same time explains how it will leverage Cardano's features. It presents a dev pathway that is understandable even to voters unfamiliar with IT developments. A timeline against this will provide a trackable mechanism to assess where the project is at and how it is meeting its milestones. This will provide better auditability and greater confidence
Reasonable proposal that would make a nice use of the blockchain. As long as security and cost issues can be resoleved.
Roadmap makes sense and the timeline for a first look is a good start in testing out how this will work in the wild. I think the developer here has all the resources to get working.

As mentioned in the proposal the project's GitHub can be monitored for progress and the evolution of it can be monitored and audited. Risks are correctly identified and a clear plan of action is presented that could serve as a base for the audits. The proposer seems engaged in the community and responsive to feedback on the proposal.

solution: DaPassword is a password manager that stores all your website passwords in the blockchain, along with bookmarks or anything important.
experience: Tech Lead with 20+ years of software development experience, masters degree in computer science, creator of multiple open-source projects.
